benchmark_details.name: NLPBench (Natural Language Processing Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: NLPBench is a novel benchmarking dataset consisting of 378 college-level NLP questions from Yale Universityâ€™s final exams, aimed at evaluating the ability of large language models (LLMs) to solve NLP-related problems through various question formats.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the problem-solving capabilities of large language models (LLMs) on college-level NLP questions, focusing on their performance in multi-turn interactions.

data.source: 378 college-level NLP questions sourced from Yale University's final exams.
data.annotation: Manually curated and reviewed by experts to ensure accuracy.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the models' final answers disregarding intermediary steps.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment of the generated answers with ground truth.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using multiple models including GPT-3.5, GPT-4, and LLAMA-2.
